newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai Forever posts loss for 1996.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai Forever posts loss for 1996.

text.p: Shanghai Forever Bicycle Co Ltd posted a 37.741 million yuan loss for 1996 based on international accounting standards, the company said in a statement on Saturday.
In 1995, it registered a loss of 19.659 million yuan under international standards.

Government limitations on the sale of motorised bicycles in urban areas affected sales, resulted in excessive stocks and serious losses, according to the annual report carried by the Shanghai Securities News.
Shanghai Forever announced on Friday that 1996 net profit based on domestic accounting standards was 2.88 million yuan, down from 11.24 million in 1995.
The company said excessive production of bicycles nationwide, fierce competition and the counterfeiting of its products also cut into profits.
The company's board of directors have proposed a 1.5-for-10 bonus issue based on capital reserves, pending approval at a shareholders meeting on June 6, it said.
